result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:52 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Quintin G Poirier in court without counsel. 
There is a DAGP offer. Defendant needs to make a payment to enter into the agreement. 
10:08 AM case re called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Quintin G Poirier in court. 
Defendant has paid the DAGP fee and signs the DAGP agreement in court. Defendant waives their right to have an attorney and court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
Court withholds a finding of Guilt. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. A 12 month DAGP is filed with and accepted by the Court.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on July 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.
